intro: Lotus hebranicus, commonly known as the Syrian water-lily, is a perennial aquatic plant native to the Middle East and North Africa. It thrives in shallow freshwater environments such as ponds, lakes, and wetlands. The plant features broad, floating leaves and produces showy, pink to white flowers that bloom in summer. Its roots are adapted for anchoring in muddy substrates, while its rhizomes allow for vegetative propagation. Lotus hebranicus plays a role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat for aquatic life and contributing to water filtration.
